comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: It's Marion HOLLINS as written on the plate. Could be the Marion Hollins (1892-1944) who was daughter of a New York banker, golfer and horsewoman, founder of the Women's National Golf Club: www.svchamber.org/svhistory/history/hollins.htm

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for pointing out the correct spelling of her name. We'll fix it in our source data (which will enable people to find her more easily alongside other photographs of her in our online catalog - www.loc.gov/rr/print/catalog.html )) and then reload the data to Flickr.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- the spelling of her name still is not corrected.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: New York society bluebloods in attendance at the horse races at Belmont Park, on June 17, 1913. A story in the New York Times the next day reported the roster of winners: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9406E...
